intro: Euphrasia brownii var. psilantherea, commonly known as the brown's beard tongue, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and small, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which are usually yellow or orange, bloom in late spring to early summer. Euphrasia brownii var. psilantherea is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, making it an adaptable and resilient species.
